author: potuz
content:
Block building is currently centralized and two gateways produce essentially all blocks. Every single validator is connected to these two entities via a single middleware. Was there ever an answer as to why the following is not a  probable outcome to FOCIL:
1. I write a middleware like commit boost. All proposers connect to it. 
2. Searchers send bundles to a centralized party that sells bottom of block inclusion. 
3. IL Proposers get their ILs from the middleware. 
4. Proposer gets the block big from the middleware that enforces the right preconf gateway was used for the ILs and it corresponds to the builder of the block. 
CC <@361447803194441738> you've been thinking about preconfs. I'm just skeptical that ILs aren't profitable to sell.

author: jochembrouwer
content: If you have a tx where you want to be sure that it is included in the first "half" of the block (measured in gas units) then create a tx with a gas limit which is half of the block gas limit. It can then not be included in the block if more than half of the block gas limit is already spent

author: sky.cactus
content: Expensive, but interesting.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Note that this does not necessarily consume all gas: sender just has to have enough funds to cover that gas. So if you would have a simple eth transfer, but do not want it to be included in the last half of the block, you thus send the eth transfer with a gas limit of half the block gas limit. But, you still pay for 21000 gas units after the execution (you just have to have enough upfront cost in order for the transaction to be included at that point), you wil not have to pay half the block gas limit for the execution.

author: soispoke
content:
I don't think that's true, for txn inclusion ***that is ordering dependent*** you can only get it from the proposer.

For inclusion only (ordering agnostic) you could buy it from IL committee members, but then again your txn or bundle will be made public to everyone including the proposer who has a last look/say so he can place your txn anywhere he wants.

To sum up:  
- If you want preconfs and ordering guarantees, dealing with the builder directly is much easier (no need to go through IL committee members) 
- If you want to be included (no ordering guarantees), just submit via the public mempool and honest IL committee members will include your txn in their ILs. 
- The only case in which it's worth trying to get your txn into an IL rather than through the public mempool is when the proposer is actively censoring this transaction. This will never get you ordering guarantees, but will force the builder to include it in its block.
